summary:
Quezon City is the most populous city in the Philippines, with over 2.9 million people. Founded in 1939, it was named after President Manuel L. Quezon. The city was designed to be the new capital, replacing Manila due to its overcrowding issues. It became the capital in 1949, but this status was later revoked in 1976.

Known as the "City of Stars," it is a hub for culture, entertainment, and media. Major broadcasting networks operate here. The city is also important for commerce, education, and politics. Quezon City is a planned city, covering a large area in Metro Manila, and is home to many government buildings and agencies.
title: Quezon City
